byline.original: By PETER BAKER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: Iran says it has disabled bomb-making capabilities of its nuclear reactor at Arak in course of meeting obligations under recent international nuclear accord; Pres Obama prepares for possible veto of bill which would compromise agreement by continuing sanctions against Iran.
snippet: Iran reported on Monday that it had removed the core of its plutonium-producing nuclear reactor at Arak as part of its efforts to complete its obligations under a new international agreement....

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

lead_paragraph: Iran reported on Monday that it had removed the core of its plutonium-producing nuclear reactor at Arak as part of its efforts to complete its obligations under a new international agreement.

headline.main: Iran Reports Removing Core From Reactor
headline.print_headline: Iran Reports Removing Core From Reactor
